result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica L. Foreman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:33 a.m. Defendant Jessica L. Foreman in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf193, 15cf230 and 15cf231. Schiek/Voorhees statement to global resolution. In 15cf193 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 3 - Granted; State moves to amend Count 4 to ordinance possession - Granted. In 15cf230, State moves to amend Count 1 to Criminal Trespass to property - violation of 943.14 - Class A Misdemeanor; amend Count 2 to Misdemeanor Theft - violation of 943.20(1)(a); and Count 4 to Entry into a Locked Dwelling - violation of 943.15- A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read-in 15CF231 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest pleas to all counts. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. In 15cf230 - Count 3 - Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts defendant's plea, defers judgment and accepts DEJ. Victim Impact Statements filed. Schiek/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
15CF193 - Count 4
Fine  - $263.50

15cf230
WHS/POP - 2 years cc all counts
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Conditional Jail - 45 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before 3-916 at 8:00 a.m. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.

Probation to dismiss DEJ if successfully completed. 
Adj. 12:02 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:12 p.m. Defendant Jessica L. Foreman in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf230, 15cf193, and 15cf231. Voorhees - in receipt of Information in all 3 cases - waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 11:00 am. Adj. 3:17 pm
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

12:00 p.m. Defendant Jessica L. Foreman in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she was in Branch 2 waiting for case to be called. Schiek statement as to witnesses. Calling 15cf193, 15cf230 and 15cf231. 
15cf193
Oneida County Sheriff's Department Deputy Kelly Moermond sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/cross by Voorhees. Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial. Bail continued.

15cf231
Rhinelander PD Officer Kurt Helke sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/Exhibit 1 (bond) marked - received/cross by Voorhees.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial. Bail continued. 

15cf230
Rhinelander PD Officer Kyle Parish sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/cross by Voorhees. Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial. Court quashes warrant. Bail continued.

State to file Information in all cases.  Arraignment scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adj. 12:45 p.m.

11:37 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf293, 15cf230 and 15cf231. State has 4 officers in Court - Voorhees has no information for Court regarding Defendant's whereabouts--attempted to call defendant - reached voicemail - voicemail box was full or not set-up unable to leave message.  Court authorizes arrest warrant on all files. Adj. 11:39 a.m.
No entry upon Briar House premises

1:25 p.m. Defendant Jessica L. Foreman in court, via video, in custody, with Attorney John E Voorhees. Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf193, 15cf230, 15cf231. Initial appearances in 15cf230 and 15cf231 - Court questions defendant to non-appearance - Defendant states she went out of town with boyfriend in Green Bay and completely forgot court date.   In receipt of complaint - Michlig/Voorhees statement to bail - One preliminary hearing to be set for all cases. Court sets cash bond in 15cf230 and 15cf231 - $750 each case in 15cf231 - no entry upon Briar House - 15cf230 No contact with Ms. Bella. Court reinstates sig bond in 15cf193  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 11:30 am. Adj. 1:34 p.m.
2:49 p.m. Defendant Jessica L. Foreman not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf231 and 15cf230. No proof of service in either case. Adjourned.
